keyTakeAways: A major road crash on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda resulted in 46 fatalities, with the initial death toll of 63 being revised down after errors in identifying unconscious victims.
The crash involved four vehicles, including two buses traveling in opposite directions, which collided head-on after a dangerous overtaking maneuver.
The crash triggered a chain reaction, including a head-on and side collision, leading to multiple vehicles overturning and widespread injuries.
Regional Police spokesperson Julius Hakiiza identified the cause as a bus attempting to overtake two vehicles (a lorry and a car) on the highway.
President Yoweri Museveni expressed sorrow and announced financial aid: five million shillings ($1,430) per bereaved family and one million shillings to injured passengers.
The Kampala-Gulu Highway is one of Uganda's busiest and most critical transportation corridors, increasing the significance of road safety concerns.
Police have urged motorists to avoid dangerous overtaking, emphasizing it as a leading cause of crashes in the country.
An official investigation has been launched to determine the exact cause of the accident, with ongoing efforts to verify casualty numbers and improve safety measures.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A deadly road crash on the Kampala-Gulu Highway in Uganda resulted in 46 fatalities after two buses traveling in opposite directions collided head-on while attempting to overtake a lorry and a car. The crash triggered a chain reaction involving multiple vehicles, leading to widespread destruction and injuries. Police revised the death toll from 63 to 46, clarifying that earlier figures included unconscious victims. Regional Police spokesperson Julius Hakiiza attributed the accident to dangerous overtaking behavior, which remains a leading cause of crashes in Uganda. President Yoweri Museveni expressed condolences and directed financial aid to affected families and injured individuals. The incident has prompted public calls for improved road safety, especially during nighttime driving, and an ongoing investigation into the cause of the crash.
